message_1: Suppose $E$ and $F$ are vector bundles over a compact topological space $X$. Given that both $E$ and $F$ are of rank $n$, what is the rank of the vector bundle $E \oplus F$?
message_2:
The rank of a vector bundle is the dimension of its fibers. Given that both $E$ and $F$ are of rank $n$, their fibers have dimension $n$. 

The direct sum of two vector bundles, $E \oplus F$, is a new vector bundle whose fibers are the direct sum of the fibers of $E$ and $F$. In this case, the fiber of $E \oplus F$ at a point $x \in X$ is given by $(E \oplus F)_x = E_x \oplus F_x$. 

Since the direct sum of two vector spaces has a dimension equal to the sum of the dimensions of the original vector spaces, the dimension of the fiber $(E \oplus F)_x$ is $n + n = 2n$. 

Therefore, the rank of the vector bundle $E \oplus F$ is $2n$.
